description: Jina is the cloud-native neural search solution powered by state-of-the-art AI and deep learning technology

options.help:
The name of this object.

This will be used in the following places:
- how you refer to this object in Python/YAML/CLI
- visualization
- log message header
- ...

When not given, then the default naming strategy will apply.
options.name: name

options.help: The working directory for any IO operations in this object. If not set, then derive from its parent `workspace`.
options.name: workspace

options.help: The YAML config of the logger used in this object.
options.name: log_config

options.help: If set, then no log will be emitted from this object.
options.name: quiet

options.help: If set, then exception stack information will not be added to the log
options.name: quiet_error

options.help: The identity of a ZMQRuntime. It is used for unique socket identification towards other ZMQRuntimes.
options.name: zmq_identity

options.help: The port for controlling the runtime, default a random port between [49152, 65535]
options.name: port_ctrl

options.help: If set, use ipc protocol for control socket
options.name: ctrl_with_ipc

options.help: The timeout in milliseconds of the control request, -1 for waiting forever
options.name: timeout_ctrl

options.help: The SSH server through which the tunnel will be created, can actually be a fully specified `user@server:port` ssh url.
options.name: ssh_server

options.help: This specifies a key to be used in ssh login, default None. regular default ssh keys will be used without specifying this argument.
options.name: ssh_keyfile

options.help: The ssh password to the ssh server.
options.name: ssh_password

options.help:
The config of the executor, it could be one of the followings:
        * an Executor-level YAML file path (.yml, .yaml, .jaml)
        * a docker image (must start with `docker://`)
        * the string literal of a YAML config (must start with `!` or `jtype: `)
        * the string literal of a JSON config

        When use it under Python, one can use the following values additionally:
        - a Python dict that represents the config
        - a text file stream has `.read()` interface
options.name: uses

options.help: Dictionary of keyword arguments that will override the default `with configuration` provided to the executor in `uses`
options.name: override_with

options.help: Dictionary of keyword arguments that will override the default `metas configuration` provided to the executor in `uses`
options.name: override_metas

options.help:
The customized python modules need to be imported before loading the executor

Note, when importing multiple files and there is a dependency between them, then one has to write the dependencies in
reverse order. That is, if `__init__.py` depends on `A.py`, which again depends on `B.py`, then you need to write:

--py-modules __init__.py --py-modules B.py --py-modules A.py
options.name: py_modules

options.help: The port for input data, default a random port between [49152, 65535]
options.name: port_in

options.help: The port for output data, default a random port between [49152, 65535]
options.name: port_out

options.help: The host address for input, by default it is 0.0.0.0
options.name: hosts_in_connect

options.help: The host address for input, by default it is 0.0.0.0
options.name: host_in

options.help: The host address for output, by default it is 0.0.0.0
options.name: host_out

options.help: The socket type for input port
options.name: socket_in

options.help: The socket type for output port
options.name: socket_out

options.help: The memory high watermark of this pod in Gigabytes, pod will restart when this is reached. -1 means no restriction
options.name: memory_hwm

options.help:
The skip strategy on exceptions.

- IGNORE: Ignore it, keep running all Executors in the sequel flow
- SKIP_HANDLE: Skip all Executors in the sequel, only `pre_hook` and `post_hook` are called
- THROW_EARLY: Immediately throw the exception, the sequel flow will not be running at all

Note, `IGNORE`, `SKIP_EXECUTOR` and `SKIP_HANDLE` do not guarantee the success execution in the sequel flow. If something
is wrong in the upstream, it is hard to carry this exception and moving forward without any side-effect.
options.name: on_error_strategy

options.help: The entrypoint command overrides the ENTRYPOINT in Docker image. when not set then the Docker image ENTRYPOINT takes effective.
options.name: entrypoint

options.help:
Dictionary of kwargs arguments that will be passed to Docker SDK when starting the docker '
container. 

More details can be found in the Docker SDK docs:  https://docker-py.readthedocs.io/en/stable/
options.name: docker_kwargs

options.help: Pull the latest image before running
options.name: pull_latest

options.help:
The path on the host to be mounted inside the container. 

Note, 
- If separated by `:`, then the first part will be considered as the local host path and the second part is the path in the container system. 
- If no split provided, then the basename of that directory will be mounted into container's root path, e.g. `--volumes="/user/test/my-workspace"` will be mounted into `/my-workspace` inside the container. 
- All volumes are mounted with read-write mode.
options.name: volumes

options.help: The host address of the runtime, by default it is 0.0.0.0.
options.name: host

options.help: The port of the host exposed to the public
options.name: port_expose

options.help: If set, respect the http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables. otherwise, it will unset these proxy variables before start. gRPC seems to prefer no proxy
options.name: proxy

options.help: Do not display the streaming of remote logs on local console
options.name: quiet_remote_logs

options.help:
The files on the host to be uploaded to the remote
workspace. This can be useful when your Pod has more
file dependencies beyond a single YAML file, e.g.
Python files, data files.

Note,
- currently only flatten structure is supported, which means if you upload `[./foo/a.py, ./foo/b.pp, ./bar/c.yml]`, then they will be put under the _same_ workspace on the remote, losing all hierarchies.
- by default, `--uses` YAML file is always uploaded.
- uploaded files are by default isolated across the runs. To ensure files are submitted to the same workspace across different runs, use `--workspace-id` to specify the workspace.
options.name: upload_files

options.help: The Pea attempts to terminate all of its Runtime child processes/threads on existing. setting it to true basically tell the Pea do not wait on the Runtime when closing
options.name: daemon

options.help: The parallel backend of the runtime inside the Pea
options.name: runtime_backend

options.help: The runtime class to run inside the Pea
options.name: runtime_cls

options.help: The timeout in milliseconds of a Pea waits for the runtime to be ready, -1 for waiting forever
options.name: timeout_ready

options.help: The map of environment variables that are available inside runtime
options.name: env

options.help: If set, expose the public IP address to remote when necessary, by default it exposesprivate IP address, which only allows accessing under the same network/subnet. Important to set this to true when the Pea will receive input connections from remote Peas
options.name: expose_public

options.help: The executor attached after the Peas described by --uses, typically before sending to all parallels, accepted type follows `--uses`
options.name: uses_before

options.help: The executor attached after the Peas described by --uses, typically used for receiving from all parallels, accepted type follows `--uses`
options.name: uses_after

options.help: The number of parallel peas in the pod running at the same time, `port_in` and `port_out` will be set to random, and routers will be added automatically when necessary
options.name: parallel

options.help: The number of replicas in the pod, `port_in` and `port_out` will be set to random, and routers will be added automatically when necessary
options.name: replicas

options.help:
The polling strategy of the Pod (when `parallel>1`)
- ANY: only one (whoever is idle) Pea polls the message
- ALL: all Peas poll the message (like a broadcast)
options.name: polling

options.help: The strategy of scheduling workload among Peas
options.name: scheduling

options.help: The Pod will be considered an external Pod that has been started independently from the Flow.This Pod will not be context managed by the Flow.
options.name: external

options.help:
The hosts of the peas when parallel greater than 1.
        Peas will be evenly distributed among the hosts. By default,
        peas are running on host provided by the argument ``host``
options.name: peas_hosts

options.help: The YAML file represents a flow
options.name: uses

options.help: The map of environment variables that are available inside runtime
options.name: env

options.help:
The strategy on those inspect pods in the flow.

    If `REMOVE` is given then all inspect pods are removed when building the flow.
options.name: inspect

options.help: The host address of the target Pea, e.g. 0.0.0.0
options.name: host

options.help: The control port of the target pod/pea
options.name: port

options.help:
Timeout in millisecond of one check
-1 for waiting forever
options.name: timeout

options.help: The max number of tried health checks before exit with exit code 1
options.name: retries

options.help: If set, print the response when received
options.name: print_response

options.help:
The skip strategy on exceptions.

- IGNORE: Ignore it, keep running all Executors in the sequel flow
- SKIP_HANDLE: Skip all Executors in the sequel, only `pre_hook` and `post_hook` are called
- THROW_EARLY: Immediately throw the exception, the sequel flow will not be running at all

Note, `IGNORE`, `SKIP_EXECUTOR` and `SKIP_HANDLE` do not guarantee the success execution in the sequel flow. If something
is wrong in the upstream, it is hard to carry this exception and moving forward without any side-effect.
options.name: on_error_strategy

options.help: The number of pre-fetched requests from the client
options.name: prefetch

options.help: The number of additional requests to fetch on every receive
options.name: prefetch_on_recv

options.help: The title of this HTTP server. It will be used in automatics docs such as Swagger UI.
options.name: title

options.help: The description of this HTTP server. It will be used in automatics docs such as Swagger UI.
options.name: description

options.help: If set, a CORS middleware is added to FastAPI frontend to allow cross-origin access.
options.name: cors

options.help: If set, the default swagger ui is used for `/docs` endpoint.
options.name: default_swagger_ui

options.help: If set, /status /post endpoints are removed from HTTP interface.
options.name: no_debug_endpoints

options.help:
If set, /index, /search, /update, /delete endpoints are removed from HTTP interface.

        Any executor that has `@requests(on=...)` bind with those values will receive data requests.
options.name: no_crud_endpoints

options.help: A JSON string that represents a map from executor endpoints (`@requests(on=...)`) to HTTP endpoints.
options.name: expose_endpoints

options.help:
The compress algorithm used over the entire Flow.

    Note that this is not necessarily effective,
    it depends on the settings of `--compress-min-bytes` and `compress-min-ratio`
options.name: compress

options.help: The original message size must be larger than this number to trigger the compress algorithm, -1 means disable compression.
options.name: compress_min_bytes

options.help: The compression ratio (uncompressed_size/compressed_size) must be higher than this number to trigger the compress algorithm.
options.name: compress_min_ratio

options.help: Communication protocol between server and client.
options.name: protocol

options.help: The host address of the runtime, by default it is 0.0.0.0.
options.name: host

options.help: The port of the host exposed to the public
options.name: port_expose

options.help: If set, respect the http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables. otherwise, it will unset these proxy variables before start. gRPC seems to prefer no proxy
options.name: proxy

options.name: runtime_cls

options.name: memory_hwm

options.help:
The skip strategy on exceptions.

- IGNORE: Ignore it, keep running all Executors in the sequel flow
- SKIP_HANDLE: Skip all Executors in the sequel, only `pre_hook` and `post_hook` are called
- THROW_EARLY: Immediately throw the exception, the sequel flow will not be running at all

Note, `IGNORE`, `SKIP_EXECUTOR` and `SKIP_HANDLE` do not guarantee the success execution in the sequel flow. If something
is wrong in the upstream, it is hard to carry this exception and moving forward without any side-effect.
options.name: on_error_strategy

options.help: The entrypoint command overrides the ENTRYPOINT in Docker image. when not set then the Docker image ENTRYPOINT takes effective.
options.name: entrypoint

options.help:
Dictionary of kwargs arguments that will be passed to Docker SDK when starting the docker '
container. 

More details can be found in the Docker SDK docs:  https://docker-py.readthedocs.io/en/stable/
options.name: docker_kwargs

options.help: Pull the latest image before running
options.name: pull_latest

options.help:
The path on the host to be mounted inside the container. 

Note, 
- If separated by `:`, then the first part will be considered as the local host path and the second part is the path in the container system. 
- If no split provided, then the basename of that directory will be mounted into container's root path, e.g. `--volumes="/user/test/my-workspace"` will be mounted into `/my-workspace` inside the container. 
- All volumes are mounted with read-write mode.
options.name: volumes

options.help: The host address of the runtime, by default it is 0.0.0.0.
options.name: host

options.help: The port of the host exposed to the public
options.name: port_expose

options.help: If set, respect the http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables. otherwise, it will unset these proxy variables before start. gRPC seems to prefer no proxy
options.name: proxy

options.help: Do not display the streaming of remote logs on local console
options.name: quiet_remote_logs

options.help:
The files on the host to be uploaded to the remote
workspace. This can be useful when your Pod has more
file dependencies beyond a single YAML file, e.g.
Python files, data files.

Note,
- currently only flatten structure is supported, which means if you upload `[./foo/a.py, ./foo/b.pp, ./bar/c.yml]`, then they will be put under the _same_ workspace on the remote, losing all hierarchies.
- by default, `--uses` YAML file is always uploaded.
- uploaded files are by default isolated across the runs. To ensure files are submitted to the same workspace across different runs, use `--workspace-id` to specify the workspace.
options.name: upload_files

options.help: The Pea attempts to terminate all of its Runtime child processes/threads on existing. setting it to true basically tell the Pea do not wait on the Runtime when closing
options.name: daemon

options.help: The parallel backend of the runtime inside the Pea
options.name: runtime_backend

options.help: The runtime class to run inside the Pea
options.name: runtime_cls

options.help: The timeout in milliseconds of a Pea waits for the runtime to be ready, -1 for waiting forever
options.name: timeout_ready

options.help: The map of environment variables that are available inside runtime
options.name: env

options.help: If set, expose the public IP address to remote when necessary, by default it exposesprivate IP address, which only allows accessing under the same network/subnet. Important to set this to true when the Pea will receive input connections from remote Peas
options.name: expose_public

options.help: The host address of the runtime, by default it is 0.0.0.0.
options.name: host

options.help: The port of the host exposed to the public
options.name: port_expose

options.help: If set, respect the http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables. otherwise, it will unset these proxy variables before start. gRPC seems to prefer no proxy
options.name: proxy

options.help: If set, then the input and output of this Client work in an asynchronous manner.
options.name: asyncio

options.help: Communication protocol between server and client.
options.name: protocol

options.help: The YAML file path for storing the exported API
options.name: yaml_path

options.help: The JSON file path for storing the exported API
options.name: json_path

options.help: The JSONSchema file path for storing the exported API
options.name: schema_path

name: Jina
